function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increased speed of communication mediums leading to rapid spread of misinformation about diseases","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Collaboration in new ways leading to the spread of unverified research findings or unreliable data","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Intersection of sonic and textual outputs leading to the misinterpretation of research findings or communication of inaccurate information","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Overreliance on digital health practices","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of sustainable integration of digital health practices","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid rollout of digital tools and packages in the medtech sector","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Switch from in-person to remote consultation methods in healthcare","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid navigation of governance and digital integration for digital care processes","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Rapid education of healthcare workforce leading to potential gaps in knowledge and skills","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of digital health solutions for rapid redeployment education","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of technical language without context","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks associated with viewpoint-independent human classification algorithm that may lead to overlooking potential health risks and disease transmission patterns","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of ai and computer vision technology for social distancing monitoring","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Utilization of human detector model for monitoring public spaces","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on technology for identifying social distancing violations may lead to errors in detection and interpretation of human behaviors","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Detection of people with partial visibility or truncated objects","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in extreme lighting conditions and lens distortion effects","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of real-time performance hardware with low accuracy in social distancing monitoring","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure of social distancing monitoring models with low speed","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Frequent cases of occlusions, overlaps, and crowded zones in the dataset","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Benchmarking tests and comparisons conducted on a single hardware and software platform","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Training on a large number of samples from the google open images dataset, including human body parts, increases the risk of model overfitting to specific characteristics of that dataset and may not generalize well to other datasets","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Utilizing a transfer learning approach with pre-trained models may introduce biases and assumptions from the source dataset microsoft coco into the human detection model, leading to biased predictions and potential fairness issues","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Using stochastic gradient descent sgd with warm restarts and a cosine annealing learning rate schedule may lead to challenges in hyperparameter tuning and model convergence, as well as the need for careful adjustment of learning rate values","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate training data for human detection model","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the geometric transformation and mapping in the context of computer vision","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Using euclidean distance in 2d space for inter-people distance estimation","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of mosaic data augmentation, class label smoothing, and dropblock regularisation in the input part of the detection module","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Utilization of the simple online and real-time sort tracking technique for people tracking and id assignment","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on the hungarian optimization technique for assigning unique id numbers to individuals","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of complex mathematical equations may lead to errors in implementation or simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient spatial pooling operations may impact the accuracy and efficiency of the model","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of selective search and region proposal for two-stage detectors may introduce potential biases in object detection","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential difficulty in dealing with low-resolution images","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in detecting small objects in images","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Loss of local information during feature extraction process","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of dense models and multiple layers may increase the complexity of the model, making it harder to train","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Selection of a backbone architecture with a higher number of parameters may lead to increased complexity and resource requirements","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of data augmentation techniques such as mosaic may create a false sense of data variety and lead to overfitting if not used simulation risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Selection and evaluation of activation functions may result in suboptimal model performance","category":"Modeling and simulation distance estimation in crowds","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standard comparison on common datasets for people detection and distance detection","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of statistical analysis provided for the outcome of the distance violation index","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
